messages.message:
24.22 is in prod and this is finally working.
@Nathaniel - could you test out this chatbot when you have a chance? https://aihub.instabase.com/hub/apps/shared/avi.vaid/D&D%20Rulebook

The chatbot is good overall, but potentially limited by the fact that it can't explicitly pull knowledge in from the copyrighted D&D books, like the Dungeon Master's Guide or Xanathar's Guide to Everything.  I had my wife (who's also an avid D&D player) try it out, and she was impressed, but quickly ran into these limitations.
• Screenshot 1 covers a specific gameplay mechanic that is in the DMG, which AI Hub handled well by only answering from the source text while indicating that a better answer is available in the DMG, likely due to GPT's general knowledge.
• Screenshot 2's question mentions a playable character race only found in the Spelljammer book.  While the answer is good and based 100% on the source text, it kinda doesn't take into account the fact that she specifically asked about a _Plasmoid_ Ranger, as that answer would equally apply to any Ranger.
• Screenshot 3 meanwhile gave a bit of an odd answer, starting with an evaluation of sorts about the actual answer provided below.
Overall, I think this chatbot is ready for public consumption, mainly being limited by our inability to add copyrighted material on a public chatbot.  Perhaps in any promotion around this, we can encourage people to create their own converse sessions (conversations?) adding more of their own books for a more comprehensive knowledge base.  Relatedly, do we currently have a feature on our roadmap to allow users to fork a published chatbot, such as taking this one and uploading more PDFs to its databank?
Are they copyrighted in the sense that you have to pay for them, or can you freely download them, they are just copyrighted? Just wondering if that would make a difference

That's a good question.  I'm not aware of a place that anyone can download the other books without having purchased access to them or via piracy.  I'll ask my friends who have sent me various PDFs how they acquired them.  :sweat_smile:
